intro: Clibadium microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed devil's claw, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
